FuncDef:
The authentication exclude command configures LDP peers in a batch that a local device does not authenticate after LDP authentication is configured to authenticate all LDP peers or LDP peers in a specified group.
The undo authentication exclude command enables a local device to authenticate all LDP peers.
By default, a local device is enabled to authenticate all LDP peers.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an LDP peer.
This value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, a local device is enabled to authenticate all LDP peers after LDP authentication is configured for a peer group or all LDP peers. To disable the local device from authenticating some LDP peers, run the authentication exclude command.
Precautions
The following commands are mutually exclusive for a specified LDP peer:
authentication key-chainmd5-password (LDP)
